title: Do you think that our smart devices are 'listening' to us? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hell yes and some are able to take video too. Your computer, smart phone, Siri, Alexa, and your smart watch can all be accessed. They can turn themselves on and of when they want. (BTW, you better get that snoring checked. You might be having sleep apnea.) They can track your location with about half a mile. They can check you pulse rate and blood pressure. The government, industry, and random hacker can get all that information. This can be combined with medical, employment, and legal information to get a complete picture of you. Every login and complete sessions on the internet you perform is tracked and recorded. Even your own security cameras can be hacked.

By default, yes it is. You need to manually opt out of it and turn it off. Google is very clever and they hid away the settings and make it very hard to find.. but you can turn off Google Assistant listening to you. Same with Amazon Alexa except Amazon is always recording because it's trying to listen to your commands.. same with Google Home and Apple Home Speakers. If you want to see how creepy Google is, go to Welcome to My Activity and look at all the Google Voice Assistant commands you made, they recorded your voice and saved it. Google Maps and YouTube also saves your history, you can turn it off from that link above.

Yes and no. The microphones are always powered on for most “agents” if only to be certain of catching your activation phrase (“Hey Siri”). Don’t worry. Your appliances aren’t conspiring against you. This “waiting state” is no more sinister than the “waiting state” your TV assumes after you click the remote control to “off”. Many models don’t turn off the entire set, but leave some portions active to accept future commands when next you start mashing pudgy fingers on tiny buttons. Yes, you can still shut your appliances “off,” but it will entail flipping a switch on the back of your gizmo.

I hope so. That is why I paid for the things. I would really dislike it if my Google Home answered “what? I wasn’t listening…” I also don’t mind that they record what I say. I have found it very handy to have my trips dated and shown on a map by Google. I also do not mind that it records what I search for etc. I found it useful when I forget something to be able to look it up. I guess if I was afraid to reveal what I a doing or saying, I might mind. But then it is my choice to get listened to or not.

Do you think that our smart devices are "listening" to us? Sure they are.. “Hey Siri”, “Ok Google”.. They are constantly listening, and respond when keywords or phrases are used.. But even if they don’t log everything they hear where you can find it, doesn’t mean they don’t hear everything.. Remember reading Alexa devices recording a home invasion?? Do you think the homeowner said “Alexa, record everything you hear for the next ten minutes”?? The only way they can respond to specific keywords is if they’re always listening..

With the right App, I can turn on your camera and microphone without your knowledge and stream it anywhere in the world. I can also turn on your GPS tracking without your knowledge. I can upload your old photos and activity and intercept all of your inputs/keystrokes. I can do this on your laptop, Mac, Android, and iPhone, smart/fit watch, remote monitoring baby/door monitors, and voice command devices.. All of this is technically possible by loading the right malware on your device. This is why you need to be very vigilant with security. Make that active security and not just a download type perimeter defense.

I have a conversation with my wife. She goes upstairs and gets an ad for exactly what we were discussing. I speak to someone new. They are suggested as a friend on my laptop. They are listening to everyone and everything. They are not to intelligent as to what to do with the info yet. Currently they are just creepy.

No matter what they say, the government have access to your smart devices, but your echo most likely isn’t listening to you 99% of the time. If you were a highly wanted criminal, though, the government probably are listening.
